title: Digestion of food
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Biology - Study and teaching
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Body, Human
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Digestion
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Stomach
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Mouth
Mathematics, Science & Technology/Biology - Study and teaching
description: A summary of the digestive process, including the following aspects: the function of the mouth; stomach, and small intestine; secretions and enzymes - the systems affected and the products formed; reactions, digestive movements, and their control (recorded by microphotography); the relation of the circulatory and nervous systems to the digestive process; motility of the digestive tract - normal movements, hypermotility, inhibition, hunger contractions, segmentations, peristalsis and anti-peristalsis; and motility of the intestinal villi.
